text:
Hello everyone,

Is there a way to force a pipeline to run its nodes in the order they are declared within the pipeline ?

I know that I can create a dummy output just to force one node to run after another but I’d like to know if there is a better way to accomplish this

Thanks

replies.text: Why do you need ordering other than topologically sorted one?
You can always implement custom runner btw

I have 2 nodes in my pipelines:
• Node 1: Does some processing and saves a parquet file on S3
• Node 2: has a sql query as input. The sql query creates an external table in snowflake that uses that saved parquet file
So, node 2 depends on node 1 but not in an explicit way (the input of node 2 is not dependent on the output of node 1)

I feel that this should be added as an example of a <https://kedro.readthedocs.io/en/stable/nodes_and_pipelines/pipeline_introduction.html#bad-pipelines|bad pipeline> in the documentation :sweat_smile:
It would be safer to return some metadata (e.g. a path to the parquet file saved on s3) from node 1 and use it as an input to the node 2
I think that is what I’m going to do :+1:
Yeah fake ‘pass through’ nodes are the way to do this if you really need, but topological should get you most of the way
